SENT.plain: Seven children underwent magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) of the bone marrow: results showed that it is technically feasible to obtain good MR images of marrow in children
MR has detected abnormality in the bone marrow of a child who had metastatic neuroblastoma
The extent of abnormality in the femur correlated well with findings of a bone marrow isotope scan
In one child who had idiopathic aplastic anemia, diseased marrow could not be distinguished from normal marrow on MR images
MRI identified abnormality of the marrow in osteogenic sarcoma, and demonstrated change in response to chemotherapy
It displayed marrow spread of tumor as well as CT
MRI showed marrow abnormality in four children who had leukemia
